result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake R Heimann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONDITIONS OF PROBATION APPLY TO ALL COUNTS.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge per count.
Per the State, restitution has been paid in full.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

Defendant makes statement.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Court makes statement, grants motion for furlough upon bed becoming avaliable at treatment facility.   Atty Reetz will prepare order for Court's signature. Court will leave 5/12/20 resentencing hearing on the calendar for now, will wait to see what happens with treatment availability.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requested continuance, states that new charges were brought after plea agreement was reached. State responds, advises of emails from Defendant that he stopped responding to when new charges were filed, has no objection to adjournment of sentencing. Defendant responds, advises that former ADA Korb had the evidence over a year ago and said she wasn't going to file charges. Court advises Defendant of right to counsel. Defendant wants to speak with ADA regarding new file.  Status conference scheduled for July 2, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.    Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. State indicates matter is resolved, requests court set a plea/sentencing date in 30 days. Defendant agrees to removing jury trial from the calendar, requests a plea/sentencing date be set. Court removes JT from the calendar. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 29, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on February 19, 2018 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Defendant indicates he's met with the State in which ADA Grode is requesting some medical records. Defendant is trying to get those records together, requests another status. State asks that jury trial remain on the calendar, requests another status prior to the scheduled trial date. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 12, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Blake R Heimann not in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 1:20 pm, reviews events in file.  Atty Grode indicates he did meet with defendant last week, surprised he's not in court today. Defendant appears at 1:24 pm.  State advises offer was made to defendant, unsure of how defendant wishes to proceed. Defendant would like time to talk to his previous attorney and his family before proceeding. Defendant feels matter will resolve short of trial. State requests leaving JT on the calendar for now. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 30, 2018 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recalls case at 1:21 pm. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Court leaves 1/04/18 status on the calendar. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Blake R Heimann in court with attorney Brian Maloney.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file. Atty Maloney indicates the State has made a global offer to resolve all matters, expresses some concern with continued representation of defendant, moves to withdraw from all cases. Court questions defendant on Atty Maloney's request to withdraw.  Defendant has no objection to Atty Maloney withdrawing.  Court grants Atty Maloney's request to withdraw from all cases.  Court questions defendant on how he wishes to proceed. Defendant would like to talk to ADA Grode about resolution of these matters. Further discussion re: legal representation. Court encourages defendant to contact PD to see if he qualifies for their representation. If defendant doesn't qualify for PD representation, Court sends waiver of right to atty form and petition for appointment of counsel form with defendant as options for him to fill out before next hearing.  Defendant also has the option of retaining new counsel on his own. Court not removing jury trial from the calendar at this time. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
